title: 105_s1750
content: SECTION 1. ADDITIONAL CERTIFICATION REGARDING DRUG-PRODUCING AND DRUG-TRANSIT COUNTRIES. Additional Certification: Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to include criteria for countries cooperating with the United States to achieve compliance with the United Nations Convention Against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include criteria for countries cooperating with the United States to achieve compliance with the United Nations Convention Against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances. Amendments include requirements related to progress towards meeting plans, programs, or timetables identified in the President's report, and conforming amendments to various subsections. The President must submit an annual report to Congress by September 1 after consulting with the Attorney General. The President must submit a report to Congress by September 1 each year, detailing benchmarks established for countries cooperating with the United States on drug trafficking. The report should identify each country, list the benchmarks set, and describe the progress made by each country in meeting those benchmarks. The President must report to Congress on the progress made by countries in meeting drug trafficking benchmarks. A high-level contact group should be convened for Mexico in 1998. In 1998, a high-level contact group should be convened for Mexico as part of the certification process under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The provisions of the act should apply to the activities of the contact group and the certification of Mexico in 1999.
